intro: Sida rohlenae, commonly known as the Hawaiian sida, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers and palmate leaves. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
